title: Message: Property "MSBildToolsVersion' is not defined
body:
### Describe the bug
Opening the project file will show underline

### To Reproduce
1. Unload someone target project.
2. Open the csporj on visual studio.

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23723575/167529398-21bb3ee4-b5e0-4813-aaef-7d1ecba98f98.png)

nodes.body: I couldn't figure out the best area label to add to this issue. If you have write-permissions please help me learn by adding exactly one area label.
@kelicto are you using an msbuild language service for viewing this?  We're not sure where the squiggle is coming from as maybe an extension isn't working correctly.

NET Framework traditional project documentation structure description file, not some new structure type of documentation. You can create a normal project type like console and I think you can see the problem.
Do you have any visual studio extensions installed?

No, I'm not seeing this in a clean install of VS or even in my own setup which has a bunch of MSBuild custom extensions. Though, I'm also not seeing any intellisense for the properties, items and targets either!
This issue is marked as stale because feedback has been requested for 30 days with no response. Please respond within 14 days or this issue will be closed due to inactivity.

This issue was closed due to inactivity. If you can still reproduce this bug, please comment with the requested information, detailed steps to reproduce the problem, or any other notes that might help in the investigation.
